Key Match Events: Australia came from behind to beat China 3-1, ending their goal drought and giving new boss Tony Popovic a winning start
Pre-Game Insights: The Socceroos went into the game after a shock 1-0 home loss to Bahrain and a scoreless draw in Indonesia last month left them in a perilous position in Asian Group C
Post-Match Reflections: Socceroos skipper Jackson Irvine said they were calm, composed – even after they lost the first goal they stuck to the game plan
Miscellaneous Highlights: Goals from Lewis Miller, Craig Goodwin and debutant Nishan Velupillay did the damage
The match was played in front of almost 50,000 fans in Adelaide
Others: Tony Popovic’s reign as coach got off to a winning start
Graham Arnold departed as coach due to the team’s poor performance
